emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace
emerging_technologies.description: A mesh of ultra-fine electrodes capable of interfacing directly with the brain, enabling enhanced cognitive abilities and direct brain-to-machine communication.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical questions about privacy, consent, and the potential for cognitive enhancement to create social inequalities.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on overcoming regulatory hurdles, ensuring safety, and public acceptance of brain-computer interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Development Automation
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously design, code, test, and deploy software, significantly accelerating development cycles.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for widespread job displacement among software developers but also an increase in productivity and innovation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be driven by the need for faster software development, with barriers including job displacement concerns and the reliability of AI-generated code.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Utilizing quantum mechanics to enhance the security and efficiency of blockchain transactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize financial systems with unprecedented security, but also poses challenges to current encryption methods.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption hinges on the development of practical quantum computers and the evolution of blockchain technology to accommodate quantum enhancements.

mainstream_technologies.name: Fully Autonomous Electric Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Electric vehicles capable of operating without human intervention, providing safe, efficient, and eco-friendly transportation.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption due to regulatory approval, infrastructure support, and public demand for sustainable transport.

mainstream_technologies.name: Energy Harvesting Infrastructure
mainstream_technologies.description: Urban and rural infrastructure designed to harvest energy from ambient sources like solar, wind, and kinetic energy.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Adoption driven by the need for sustainable energy solutions, with progress made in integrating this technology into existing structures.

epoch_themes.description: Technological advancements aimed at enhancing human capabilities, from cognitive to physical.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for significant societal shifts in employment, education, and human interaction, raising ethical questions about augmentation and equality.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global trend towards biohacking, cognitive enhancement, and the blurring lines between human and machine.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on creating sustainable living environments through technology integration.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Aims to reduce carbon footprint, enhance urban living quality, and address climate change through smart city initiatives.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Shift towards green architecture, smart cities, and sustainable transport solutions.
